Namespaces

namespace  xint
 

All of the functions in the XInt library are within this namespace.


namespace  xint::detail
 

The items within this namespace are meant for internal use only.

Modular math functions

A common reason to use a large-integer library is to implement public-key encryption, and the algorithms for such encryption often use modular math.



integer xint::mod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the remainder after dividing a number by another.
integer xint::mulmod (const integer &n, const integer &by, const integer &m)
 Get the modular product of two integers.
integer xint::sqrmod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the modular product of squaring an integer.
integer xint::powmod (const integer &n, const integer &e, const integer &m, bool noMontgomery)
 Get the result of ne % m, keeping the intermediate results (relatively) small.
integer xint::invmod (const integer &n, const integer &m)
 Get the modular inverse of a number in a modulus, if there is one.

Some constants used by the library.



const size_t xint::detail::bits_per_digit = std::numeric_limits<digit_t>::digits
const digit_t xint::detail::digit_hibit = (digit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit-1))
const doubledigit_t xint::detail::doubledigit_hibit = (doubledigit_t(1) << (bits_per_digit*2-1))
const doubledigit_t xint::detail::digit_overflowbit = (doubledigit_t(1) << bits_per_digit)
const digit_t xint::detail::digit_mask = digit_t(digit_overflowbit-1)

Detailed Description

The main header file for the XInt library.

This is the only header that programs using the library should need to include.

Definition in file xint.hpp.
